alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued March 08 at 3:46PM AKST until March 10 at 11:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Northeast winds 35 to 55 mph with gusts up to 80 mph possible. * WHERE...Valdez through Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty outflow winds are expected to channel through Thompson Pass and into Valdez for much of Friday. Winds are expected to begin increasing Thursday evening, peaking from late Friday morning through afternoon. There remains uncertainty with the timing of peak winds. Blowing snow may occur if these strong winds resuspend fallen snow, though visibility reductions are not expected to be widespread.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
